intro: Nesaea heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf nesaea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from ovate to lanceolate, depending on environmental conditions. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Nesaea heterophylla is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops, and it is adapted to withstand dry and sunny conditions.
